messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `app/Http/Controllers/PostController.php`, I found that `PostController` is implemented to process HTTP requests. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
I found two routes handled by App\Http\Controllers\PostController in the provided route files. For each route below I list the full path and whether each HTTP method is accepted (based only on the explicit route registrations in the code you provided).

1) Endpoint: /
- Full path: / 
- all (any/ALL): false
- HEAD: false
- POST: false
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: true
- PUT: false
- DELETE: false
- PATCH: false

Explanation:
- routes/web.php contains Route::get('/', [PostController::class, 'index'])->name('home'); which explicitly registers a GET route for "/". There is no explicit registration of HEAD/POST/OPTIONS/TRACE/PUT/DELETE/PATCH or a Route::any, so only GET is accepted per the code.

2) Endpoint: /posts/{post}
- Full path: /posts/{post}
- all (any/ALL): false
- HEAD: false
- POST: false
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: true
- PUT: false
- DELETE: false
- PATCH: false

Explanation:
- routes/web.php contains Route::resource('posts', PostController::class)->only('show'); The resource "show" action creates the GET route for /posts/{post} handled by PostController::show. There is no explicit route for other HTTP verbs (and no Route::any), so only GET is accepted per the code.

Notes:
- I did not assume any implicit handling of HEAD/OPTIONS by the framework â€” the answers reflect only what is explicitly registered in the provided route files.
